questions.question: Like the, what, is there a system behind this or is there a philosophy behind this?
But on this other hand, you have to have someone who seeks out challenges, right?
It's not like wrestling where you could go the next year or the next week or whatever, you know?
Does it hurt that you're not in the discussion now of being in the top 10 of all time?
Well, the hardship, I mean, what, is there something specific about wrestling that can create so many great champions?
So it's like in wrestling, I can boil down to, I can probably name you the best six moves, right?
What would you say was like key to your dominance in that long undefeated streak?
So how difficult is that whole skill set, would you say, for a Jiu-Jitsu person to learn?
Is it just a financial investment, or is there a philosophy that attracts you to it?
